name: New York LGBTQ+ Community Events Calendar
description:
Bloom Community has created the [**NYC Pride Community Calendar**](https://www.joinbloom.community/nyc-pride-2022/) to aggregate LGBTQA+ community events happening all year round.

We invite our community members to [add your LGBTQA+ events](https://www.joinbloom.community/create-event) to the calendar and share among your friends and followers.

name: Brooklyn In Person! Lesbian, Bi, Queer and Trans Speed Dating
description:
Brooklyn singles who are tired of the apps! Make flirty or friendly connections at an evening of Lesbian, Bi, Queer, and Trans Speed Dating.

Tired of apps, but looking for a fun and easy way to meet new Lesbian, Bi, Queer and Trans singles in Brooklyn? Join Little Gay Book's Speed Dating event at Lavender Lake for new romantic (and friendly!) connections.

Join us on Thurs, October 10th from 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM EST at [Lavender Lake](https://www.lavenderlake.com/) in Brooklyn.

**_Event Timing:_**

Check-in will begin at 6:00 PM EST

**Please arrive no later than 6:25 PM EST**

**The event will begin promptly at 6:30 PM EST**

(Late arrivals will not be permitted to participate in speed dating).

üåü **Why You Can't Can't-Miss**

Imagine an evening where meeting incredible people is effortless and exhilarating. Our Personalized Speed Dating event uses cutting-edge technology to match you with potential connections. Say goodbye to the ordinary and hello to the extraordinary!

**What Awaits You:**

*   A dynamic event filled with laughter, smiles, and captivating conversations.
*   Smartphone magic that tailors each match to your preferences, so you can focus on the fun.
*   The thrill continues after the event - you'll receive contact info for your promising matches, ensuring meaningful connections!

ü•Ç T**wo drink minimum required**

Don't miss this extraordinary opportunity to forge connections with the vibrant queer community who share your passions. Act quickly before the remaining spots disappear.

**FAQ:**

**Q: How does the matching technology work?**

A: Our innovative technology allows you to tailor your event experience. You share your preferences, including age range and where your preferred date falls on the masculine-feminine spectrum. Our algorithm then matches you with like-minded individuals, ensuring a more personalized experience compared to random, public speed dating.

**Q: How can I connect with my matches after the event?**

A: After the event, you'll receive the contact information for your matches, allowing you to take those promising connections to the next level.

**Q: What should I do after the event ends?**

A: We encourage you to stay after the event, mingle, and support the venue. It's a chance for great conversations, new friendships, and connections that go beyond the event. Your continued presence can make the experience even more memorable.

**Q: Are there any specific guidelines for attendees?**

A: Yes, our Lesbian/Bi/Trans Speed Dating events are open to lesbian, bisexual, nonbinary, and genderqueer women. These events are trans-welcoming, and intolerance is not permitted.

Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity to meet incredible individuals who share your interests and aspirations. Join us for an evening filled with excitement, laughter, and the potential for meaningful connections. We can't wait to see you there!

If you have any questions or need further assistance, please don't hesitate to reach out to our friendly team at events@littlegaybook.com or (510) 254 ‚Äì 9105.

_By providing a telephone number and submitting this form you are consenting to be contacted by SMS text message. Message and data rates may apply. You can reply STOP to opt-out of further messaging._

_Please note that all ticket sales are final and non-refundable. We understand that unforeseen circumstances may arise that prevent attendance, but due to the nature of event planning and reservations, we are unable to issue refunds or transfer tickets to future events._

_We encourage you to carefully consider your schedule and commitments before purchasing tickets. In the event of unavoidable changes, such as event cancellations on our part, we will provide updates and alternative solutions._

name: Hit Me Up: Tie Me Down Rope Jam
description:
Whether you're a skilled rope artist, an experienced rope bunny, or brand new and just curious, we welcome you!

**Hit Me Up: Tie Me Down Rope Jam**

Whether you're a skilled rope artist, an experienced rope bunny, or brand new and just curious, we welcome you! You may be tethered down, or you may get to fly with us. It also might get a little bit nerdy, because, hey, rope people.

Please note that **this is not a class**! Feel free to get to know each other and share your knowledge or tie with someone new.

**Agenda**

**7.15pm:** Opening circle and introductions will begin, so please arrive by then.

**7.30pm:** Beginners corner for folks. This will be facilitated by either Syd or Trixie and will cover some rope basics.

**Additional info**

*   bring your own rope if you have it (there will be some to share if you don't)
*   bring your own shears
*   if you plan to suspend, you need your own rigging equipment
*   this is an all level event!
*   all attendees need a ticket whether self-tying, coming solo, or paired.

Your rope artist hosts for the evening:

**Trixie LaPointe**: [Mistress Trixie LaPointe](https://twitter.com/MistresLaPointe) is a rope artist and disciplinarian based in NYC. She has been exploring rope and her dominance since late 2017. The proud proprietor of her own studio space La Maison Priv√©e, where she holds various sessions as well as small classes and events.

**Sydona Rogue**: [Sydona](https://twitter.com/sydonarogue) is a Brooklyn-based rope artist, movement practitioner, and photographer who uses her training and performance experience in classical dance to inspire her ventures into experimental and experiential art of all forms. She was first introduced to the New York kink scene in 2018, and has been deepening her practice as a rope performer, educator, and facilitator ever since. In that time she has performed at events by House of Yes, House of X, House of Gemini and Scorpio, Seeking Haven, Hit Me Up!, Le Wand, Nuit des Cordes, and The Box. She's committed to creating safer kink spaces, educational opportunities, beautiful art, and connection to like-minded folks, for the sake of \*joy\* in ropes.

Want to see what other events are coming up? Join our [public newsletter](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/newsletter) and follow us on insta (@hitmeupnycity)

üíú Equity Pricing: We recognize that folks have different access to financial resources for a variety of reasons, including being of a marginalized racial identity. If you are BIPOC or do not have the financial capacity for a full-priced ticket please email admin@hitmeupnyc.com for a discount code.

üíú Volunteers: Limmitted volunteer spots for door and set up. Email admin@hitmeupnyc.com to join the team. Volunteers receive a free ticket.

üíúLocation: Lower Manhattan. The space has an elevator. Please email hello@hitmeupnyc.com if you need any accessibility accommodations. Exact address is in the confirmation email the tickets are attached to. Scroll down far enough in the email to see this information. Do not relly on the eventbrite map!

üíúDress code: Comfortable clothes for tying or being tied. Please wear some sort of bottoms that cover your genitals, but nipples of all identifications are free to get some air.

üíúFull vaccination is required. While we recommend getting the booster shots, we are not verifying them at this time.

üíúConsent Policy: This event is for ropes and other general kink play. Please keep your bottoms on during your scenes. This is an ASK FIRST event and the rules of respectful and consensual behavior WILL be enforced. You will be responsible for reading the policy and behaving appropriately. Please click here to read our consent policy in full.

üíúMembership: This event is open to the public. We reserve the right to refuse entry if needed. Hit Me Up also hosts private events which are invite only, and anyone new to Hit Me Up must apply and be approved to attend‚Äîno guests or plus ones. If you‚Äôd like to apply or invite a new member, please see [our website](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/join) for more information. You are welcome to inquire as to your status or that of your friends, but please do not act as if you have an entitlement to access our space or members. Building special spaces is hard, and while we are inclusive and welcoming, we reserve the right to curate our membership as needed to maintain our flourishing community.

üíúPlease stay home if you are feeling ill or if you have had recent close contact with someone who tested Covid positive (within the past 5 days). You could be incubating and still test negative. Any requests for refunds for any reason will be honored up to the day of the party. Remember: safe, sane, and sanitary Just email hello@hitmeupnyc.com and we will give you a full refund, no questions asked.

**HMU‚Äôs public events are 18+. Our vetted & private lists are 21+ only.**

name: POWER PLAY: Pain & Physicality
description:
### Workshop: POWER PLAY | Pain & Physicality

**Hosted by Nix (the Sirenatrix)**

> This transformative edu-series on Power - designed for Dom(mes), subs, and switches - who wish to gain a deeper understanding of influence and surrender. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned veteran, this workshop will enhance your skills and scenes - and perhaps even your perspective.

> This series of workshops will likely change the way you view power exchange, giving you a new appreciation for the intimacy involved in influence. Raising your voice in a domineering way isn‚Äôt the same as influencing your sub with a single whisper‚Äîtrue power tends to be subtle, grounded, intentional, and deeply connected. In **POWER PLAY**, you‚Äôll learn how to get someone‚Äôs entire mind, body, and soul on board with your desires. You‚Äôll learn to play with resistance, use your physicality, and make your presence felt down to the core. Every session will delve into a different facet of power dynamics. Embrace your role, refine your tools, and discover the depths of power exchange in a supportive educational environment.

**Pain & Physicality**

*   **Power in Pain**: Understand the connection between power and pain, and how to use physicality to deepen your scenes.
*   **Impact Techniques**: Learn various impact tools and techniques to create the desired level of intensity while maintaining control.
*   **Physical Power Exchange**: Utilize your bodies in more ways to create relational power.

((Come to all four workshops or drop in for just one! ))

‚Äî-------------------------------------------------------------------------

#### Workshop Format:

*   **Discussion and Practical Exercises**: The workshop will include a mix of discussions and hands-on exercises. You'll have the chance to interact with others, practice communication techniques, and receive feedback.¬†
*   **Solo and Group Work**: You can come alone or with a partner. During the exercises, you'll have the opportunity to switch partners, which allows for practicing with familiar partners and new acquaintances. This helps simulate both established dynamics and pickup play scenarios.¬†
*   **Dress Code and Interactions**: Feel free to dress however you want, whether vanilla or ready to play. Expect to interact with others for the exercises, at least in terms of communication and light D/s. More physical play will be saved for the jam afterwards. We do not pair people up, and encourage guests to make friends and engage to their level of comfort ensuring that all are able to learn and grow. Couples can stay paired the whole time or practice with others if you so choose.
*   This workshop is open to all genders, sexual orientations, lifestyles, singles, and couples. All experience levels welcome. 18+.
*   Refunds must be requested 7 days prior to the event.¬†
*   Doors open at 7:30pm and close at 7:40 pm. Please be on time and text ahead if you are delayed.¬†
*   You are welcome to wear a mask throughout the duration of the event.

#### JAM After the Workshop:

Stick around for our jam session, exclusively open to workshop participants. During the jam, you'll have the opportunity to practice your new skills on dungeon furniture in a safe and supportive environment. Nix & Rrrob will be available to offer feedback or conduct activities that cement workshop learning. This is a unique chance to develop muscle memory through hands-on experience, working and learning together in a playful setting.

#### Workshop 7:30-9:30 pm - Jam 9:45pm-11:45pm

#### _Near Herald Square / Address given in confirmation email additional info / Elevator Access available at this location_

#### Pricing:

‚óè **Workshop**: Early Bird $30, Classic $40

‚óè **Workshop and Jam**: Early $55, Classic $75

SAVE WHEN YOU GO TO ALL FOUR: Workshops $140 or Workshop + Jams $260

> POWER PLAY: Fall Series (Thursdays @ Herald Square)

> Power Dynamics 101 (Oct 3rd)

> Pain & Physicality (Oct 10th)

> Influence & Control (Oct 17th)

> Resistance & Brat Taming (Oct 24th)

name: Liaison
description:
A mixer for poly & non-monogamous folks

I invite you to my iteration of a munch/social event for the sex-positive community. We are social beings; multiple studies have detailed that being involved in groups makes things better! We need friends and social interactions. In addition, social interactions are critical for our mental health. If you're a newcomer, we welcome you with open arms; Liaison will be the ideal introduction.

At Liaison, you'll be able to:

*   Develop confidence in social settings
*   Improve your person-to-person communication skills
*   Make emotional connections
*   Convey your feelings authentically
*   Meet new and fellow sex-positive folks
*   Play interactive games

Consenting adults can be affectionate, kiss, and fondle each other to their heart's desire. Meet new and seasoned non-monogamists, polyamorists, fetishists, dominants, submissives, and hedonists, to name a few.

### Workshops & Demo's

TBA

*   Entertainment

Your ears will be pleasantly treated by our live vocalist and pianist. We'll provide a wide selection of background music to keep everyone entertained.

**Attire:**

*   Be presentable and dress in whatever makes you feel confident, sexy, and comfortable. Lack of effort and you'll be refused entry.

### Code Of Conduct

*   Consent is the top priority.
*   You must not touch anyone or their belongings without consenting first.
*   Consent can be given or taken away at any time.
*   Do not drink to the point of intoxication. If you get too drunk, we will send you home and restrict you from future events if necessary.
*   You'll receive a lifetime ban for any racist, prejudiced, Slut-shaming, homophobic, or transphobic behavior. No exceptions.
*   Be courteous, smile, and respect people's boundaries.

### Entree

$30 at the door. If ticket sales end online, you can show up and pay cash at the door.

www.consensualevents.com

### ID (21+) is required for entry

### Transportation

We're conveniently a short walking distance from the J, M & Z at Myrtle Avenue Station.

name: ARE YOU THERE, RIHANNA? IT'S ME, KYLE
description:
About
-----

Kyle is an ex-Catholic, chronically online, 20-something Gay who is neurotically obsessed with pop culture and, more specifically, female pop music. He is talkative, trend-obsessed, and allegedly ‚Äútoo much,‚Äù but his favorite thing in the world is sharing his music taste with others. In this coming-of-age tale, Kyle chronicles his life journey while performing the music and lyrics of the pop divas that have guided his life. Part-cabaret show, part-sacreligious Catholic mass, part-therapy session, ARE YOU THERE, RIHANNA? IT'S ME, KYLE is an inside look at the Gen Z experience of finding religiosity in the culture that shapes our lives and embracing queerness in the process.

This is a 21+ event

Presented by C‚Äômon Everybody.

name: Kinky Tantra + Play Jam!
description:
Facilitated by [Dominus Eros](https://www.dominuseros.com/)

_Join us in the fun and enticing worlds of Kink and Tantric Play for consensual adults._

**Kinky Tantra**

**Workshop 7-9:15 pm - Play Jam 9:30pm-12:30am**

We are having a 2-part evening of indulgence and learning. Come for the workshop and stay for the Jam to practice what you learned and meet other like-minded folks or just come to the Play Jam!!

Kinky Tantra is combining elements from Conscious BDSM and Tantra, utilizing the trust, energy dynamics and breath to create a beautifully bonded experience. You will see how the core foundations of each modality play into each other like a wonderful dance between classic "light/dark" sides of the same energetic coin.

Conscious BDSM explores the intentional connection of vulnerability, trust and awareness to create a beautiful dance of flow and movement between the giver and receiver to create intended sensations, feelings and reactions.

Tantra is an eastern practice of activating sexual energy with balance, intention and energetic sensitivity to facilitate connection with ourselves and each other.

In addition to theory and discussion, there will be practical workshop based segments to learn techniques and skills to enhance your experience. This workshop offers an introduction to Tantra and BDSM/Kink that is great for singles, couples, or more, of course keeping safety a priority.

**The Experience:**

This is an in-person workshop in a beautiful and private studio space in Manhattan. The workshop will include 2 hours of discussion & instruction where you will be able to receive and explore new techniques and positions. If you desire, you may receive hands-on practice and demonstration.

**Intended Outcomes:**

You will gain new ways to connect and bond with yourself and others that feel intimate, exciting and invigorating. You will be able to connect and explore your own relationship to this practice and all the yummy sensations possible.

*   Conscious BDSM and Tantric theories
*   How to blend the elements of Kink/BDSM and tantric energy
*   Group led meditative sequence using Kundalini Cobra Breath
*   Tantric massage techniques and demonstration
*   Practical techniques, tool overview and live demo - You will learn how to use items safely
*   Kink-inspired class, however you can dress in any gear/sexy/regular clothing if you want.
*   Safety protocol and negotiations
*   Play toys, floggers, paddles and more will be available to add to the scene and to help you create the mood for intense play and fun.

**Play Jam** is a participation based gathering where we focus on playing, trying new things and practicing what you learned or know. This time is meant for all to be involved on some level within comfort and personal boundaries to be respected.

**Jam Activities and Scenes Include:**

*   Opening Circle & Community Guidelines
*   Live demonstration & scenes
*   Multiple play spaces, X's, and open play/practice time

**What to bring?**

*   Your favorite tools & toys/props/gear
*   Open, curious minds

name: Glitterbox ‚Ä¢ Jellybean Benitez ‚Ä¢ Ladymonix ‚Ä¢ Boyyyish
description:
Description**GLITTERBOX returns for a takeover of their New York City home: House Of Yes!**

**GLITTERBOX** is an international party of House and Disco-infused dancefloor anthems. The famously colorful, diverse, and inclusive party melds with HoY to pull out all the stops, with iconic performers bringing NRG to the most euphoric music. Prepare your body and soul for an epic night of ecstatic dance, expression, and spectacle. Leave your mind behind and find your vibe on the dancefloor as we serve you the best damn house music of your LIFE!

**‚´∏ LOOKS**

glitz ‚Ä¢ celebration ‚Ä¢ bright ‚Ä¢ bold & beautiful! sparkle ‚Ä¢ shine and be divine. **See more inspiration**[](https://pin.it/l62bt3oln35mnx)

**HERE:** [https://pin.it/l62bt3oln35mnx](https://pin.it/l62bt3oln35mnx)

**‚´∏ MUSIC _(in alphabetical order)_**

[**Jellybean Benitez**](https://soundcloud.com/jellybeanbenitez)

A giant of New York City club culture during the 1980s, John ‚ÄúJellybean‚Äù Benitez was born to a Puerto Rican mother in the South Bronx. Gravitating toward music at a young age, he started frequenting disco clubs in the mid ‚Äò70s and quickly became an established DJ in the scene.

Although he would go on to play at a variety of storied nightspots, including Studio 54, Paradise Garage and Electric Circus, Benitez truly made his mark with a residency at the Fun House in Manhattan, which he held from 1981 to 1984. During those years, his production and remix career also took off, as he reworked seminal tracks from Rockers Revenge, Jimmy Spicer and Afrika Bambaataa; two of his remixes from 1983‚Äôs _Flashdance_ soundtrack also became sizeable hits. Around the same time, he was enlisted by Madonna to contribute to her debut album, producing ‚ÄúHoliday‚Äù (her first hit) and remixing several other tracks.

He would later produce and remix countless other acts throughout the decade, including Whitney Houston, Hall & Oates, Sheena Easton, Talking Heads, Billy Joel, Fleetwood Mac, The Pointer Sisters, Debbie Harry, Michael Jackson and Paul McCartney, to name just a few. Benitez also created music of his own, scoring hits with tracks like ‚ÄúSidewalk Talk‚Äù (a song co-written by Madonna) and his cover of Babe Ruth‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Mexican‚Äù before releasing his debut album, _Just Visiting This Planet_, in 1987.

He remains active on the club scene today, and is largely regarded as one of the key figures who shepherded New York City nightlife out of the disco era, not to mention a pioneer of the [freestyle genre](https://daily.redbullmusicacademy.com/specials/freestyle-oral-history/).

[**Ladymonix**](https://soundcloud.com/ladymonix)

Detroit-based DJ / producer, responsible for some of the best club-nights the city has to offer. Ladymonix taps into deep, stripped-down, classic-house elements to create raw dancefloor magic.

[**Boyyyish**](https://soundcloud.com/boyyyish)

boyyyish blends his unique ethnic background into adiverse sound journey; his sets transcend genre boundaries in his sonic exploration and expertise behind the decks, and his successive sets for Christina Visca \[Sound Factory/Paradise Garage\] and Susanne Bartsch \[Copacabana/Le Bain\] has helped establish him among NYC nightlife legends and up-and-coming acts.

He has supported the likes of Danny Krivit, Todd Edwards, Eli Escobar, Rich Medina, Dimitri from Paris, Tedd Patterson, Hex Hector, JD Samson, Lauren Flax, Kim Anh, Dana Montana, and SG Lewis. He‚Äôs produced Club Boyyyish, a techno party spotlighting BIPOC and LGBTQ+ DJs, in an effort to amplify marginalized voices in nightlife. His collective, Love Prism, with Ty Sunderland has been a queer dance staple for the past 5 years throwing some of NY‚Äôs biggest Pride events at 3 Dollar Bill and Webster Hall. His weekly radio show ‚ÄúBreakfast with boyyyish‚Äù (Thursday mornings on the [House of Yes YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/HouseofYesNYC)) delves into deep cut 80s and 90s electronic music, exploring the origins of a variety of dance music genres across the world.

**‚´∏ EXPERIENCES**

Explore, engage, connect. At every party we have participatory activities. Open your heart and immerse yourself in playful experiences and performance art designed by our resident artists. The full line-up of activations will be released on the week of the event.¬†

**‚´∏ PARTY TABLES**

Take your party to the next level. We offer packages for groups, special celebrations or just because you're fabulous. Book yours at [houseofyes.org/tables](http://houseofyes.org/tables)

or reach out to [reservations@houseofyes.org](mailto:reservations@houseofyes.org)

.

**‚´∏ GET ON THE LIST**¬†

Subscribe to the House of Yes newsletter for first access to tickets and special invites: [houseofyes.org/yesemails](https://www.houseofyes.org/yesemails)

**‚óÜSAFER SPACES POLICY‚óÜ**

House of Yes is a space for everyone to feel welcome. We have a zero tolerance policy for harassment, unwanted touch, and discrimination. Always ASK before touching anyone. If someone is making you uncomfortable, speak to a security guard or ask for a manager - we will help you, no judgment. All restrooms in our venue are gender neutral. The entrance to the venue is ADA accessible. Strobe lights are used during performances and parties. Find out more at [houseofyes.org/safer](https://www.houseofyes.org/safer)

**‚óÜINFO & FAQ‚óÜ**

21+ | No Refunds | No Re-Entry | More questions? Head to [houseofyes.org/FAQ](http://houseofyes.org/FAQ)

If you remember me (or even if you don‚Äôt), I‚Äôll be back at Blood Night: Vampire Ball. You can find me on the dancefloor raving like a lunatic. I‚Äôll be the one pretending not to be scared, secretly hoping you‚Äôll take another bite.

name: Downtown Brooklyn Polyamory Picnic in BK Bridge Park
description:
Downtown Brooklyn Polyamory is back with another picnic in the park! Join us as we welcome our local non-monogamous, polyamorous, and curious folks for conversation and connection.

As usual, expect to chat about how to be our best poly/non-monogamous selves. This event is outdoors, and will mostly be about free mingling and chatting. Whether you are a long-time group member eager to reconnect with old friends, or a first-timer looking to learn more about polyamory and non-monogamy and meet like-minded people, come join us!

**First-time attendees, please see one of the organizers when you arrive to get a welcome, a name-tag, and to be introduced to the group.** Organizers can be identified by the stars (badly) drawn on the four corners of their name-tags.

Weather permitting, we will be in Brooklyn Bridge Park in the green space just South of Pier 1 (Bridge View Lawn) from 2:00pm - 4:30pm, but feel free to stay longer. This location is a grassy field with both shade and sun. It is always wise to bring something like a blanket, towel or little tarp to sit on in case the ground is wet. Feel free to bring snacks or drinks to share, but coming empty-handed is also totally fine. In case of heavy rain, we may reschedule at the last minute, but we usually proceed if there is only a drizzle or a short shower.

This meetup is about connecting with old and new friends and sharing ideas and experiences. It is not a cruising or pickup event, so please do not come with those expectations or intentions as they can make folks uncomfortable and feel unsafe. As always, be sure to get permission before getting close to or touching any other participant. Help us keep this a safe and supportive space!

Our group values ethics, inclusion, growth and compassion as a means to support each of our unique journeys in developing non-traditional relationships. Please be prepared to bring those values, along with an awareness of the fundamental importance of consent and a respect for all others if you attend our events. We look forward to welcoming everyone interested or curious about non-monogamy and polyamory. :)

See you in the park!

Marco, Faun, & Clara

For our vetted members, this is a great chance to get to introduce yourself to the community and for us to get to know you so that we can invite you to our private events. If you're already a private member, our Hangouts are the perfect opportunity to make some new friends leading up to our upcoming private events.

Come laugh, drink, and relax it off at the HMU loft with a crowd of new and old friends.

**About the Event**

Join us as we welcome [Charmskool](https://charmskoolshop.com/en-us), the UK‚Äôs favourite Handmade K\*nk Marketplace for their first **_ever_** stateside pop up market. Shop from 20+ local & international makers selling spicy fashion (lat3x, leather, lingerie), art & toys. We‚Äôll also have some exciting activities throughout the day so look out for announcements! This event is part of a social at the expansive HMU loft, so expect drinks, tunes and chill vibes plus plenty of space to relax & meet new friends!

We are so excited to bring these incredible events together for one weekend of creative, inclusive spicy fun. Make sure you sign up for newsletters to stay in the know, **and** as a bonus, all ticket purchases come with a 15% off code to f3tish artisan website [Charmskoolshop.com](https://Charmskoolshop.com), as a welcome gift for their launch in North America!

**I'm new, what are these like?** Our Hangout events are smaller and more intimate than our mixers, anywhere from 70 to 120 people usually show up. That means there are plenty of new folks to meet, and hopefully the right types for whatever you're into. Hangouts are only open to vetted members, which means a better awareness of our community standards than our public events.

Everything is PG-13, and it's fairly easy to meet new folks‚Äîeveryone who comes to these events is specifically looking to at least make new friends. So don't be shy, introduce yourself. And if you run into any problems or someone makes you uncomfortable, talk to a guardian with a red armband, and we'll take care of it.

**Membership**: This event is open to the public. If you want to apply for our vetted membership to access our other events, you can go to [https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/join](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/join) and fill out an application.

There will be no tickets sold at the door, all attendees must purchase them in advance.

**Dress code**: There's no enforced dress code, but we recommend all black or something nice. A bit of kinky flair is always welcome. If you look like you're going to try to pitch us on a totally fair fantasy football trade or the landlord hustle lifestyle, you'll probably have less fun.

**Volunteers**: We are looking for volunteers to work the door and guardian at this event. To volunteer please reach out to admin@hitmeupnyc.com.

**Consent Policy**: This is an ASK FIRST event and the rules of respectful and consensual behavior WILL be enforced. You will be responsible for reading the policy and behaving appropriately. Guardians will be present throughout the night. Please click here to read our consent policy in full. **Aggressive cruising or aggressively asking for private member sponsorship or approval will not be tolerated.** Take time and get to know the community!

**Accessibility:** The venue is wheelchair accessible with an elevator and no stairs to the front door. If you have questions about the space please email hello@hitmeupnyc.com.

**Covid Safety:** Please stay home if you are feeling ill or if you have had recent close contact with someone who tested Covid positive (within the past 5 days). You could be incubating and still test negative. Any requests for refunds for any reason will be honored up to the day of the party. Just email hello@hitmeupnyc.com and we will give you a full refund, no questions asked.

\---

**ABOUT HIT ME UP**

**What is Hit Me Up?**

Hit Me Up is New York City‚Äôs curated community for poly and kink. We run meetups, parties, and teach kink at House of Yes, Caveat, Torture Garden, and other venues around the city.

We got our start running small events for our friends that quickly outgrew multiple venues. Now we have our own space and we are working to build the kink and poly community that NYC deserves‚Äîsafer, friendlier, and weirder.

**Why is Hit Me Up different?**

Our core value at Hit Me Up is that poly and kink should be FUN. We balance accessibility and friendliness with a selective approach to membership to ensure that we get to hang out and play in the community we want to exist. Safety and respect are the only things we always take seriously.

**How do you keep your events safe?**

‚ù£Ô∏è Our rules are actually enforced. If we say there‚Äôs a dress code, we will actually turn away anyone who doesn‚Äôt put in the effort to follow it. See our full consent policy for more details.

‚ù£Ô∏è We don‚Äôt oversell our events. There will always be space to breathe, to get away, and to get into what you‚Äôre into.

‚ù£Ô∏è Aggressive, cruising, and abusive behavior are dealt with quickly.

‚ù£Ô∏è Complaints and reports get action. We will never choose an extra ticket sale over risk to our members.

We are the guardians of the community, the space and the vibe, and we take that responsibility seriously. All of these things add up, and we think it shows in our membership and the incredible and weird things that can happen at our events.

**How Do I Become A Member?**

To join Hit Me Up, go to [hitmeupnyc.com/join](https://hitmeupnyc.com/join) and fill out the application. It helps if you have an existing member to put down as vouching for you, but it‚Äôs not necessary. Membership is completely free, and is purely for vetting and safety purposes.

**Can I get in touch with you?**

Feel free to email us, [hello@hitmeupnyc.com](https://hello@hitmeupnyc.com). Hit Me Up is run by Alice and Hawthorne, two sexy weirdos who get off on making truly magical events.

For regular updates and educational content, follow us on instagram: [@hitmeupnycity](https://www.instagram.com/hitmeupnycity/?hl=en) and sign up for our [public newsletter](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/newsletter).

That was a lot of reading, huh? Here's the thing‚Äîour ideal members are ones who read all the way to the end. Thanks for being with us. (Or just skipping to the end like an impatient middle schooler. For shame!)

**Join us for an amazing evening of sacred spiritual energy!**

Embracing the Yoga of Sound and the essence of Hatha without doing typical asana poses that we have grown to believe in as an essential element of yoga.

Hatha (Ha-Tha, described as a ‚Äúsun-Moon‚Äù)‚Ä¶. Nothing about poses.

Hatha is described as ‚Äúsun-moon‚Äù to emphasize negative-positive, male-female, these two opposite forces in nature that we meditate upon to harness constructive forceful means to bring about change to our mental and emotional state.

This nourishing and playful practice encourages delicious trance, sensual body movement, and vocal Shakti invocation.

In this practice, we constructively and playfully rebel against convention. We approach yoga in an unconventional way with trance dance and using the power of our voice.

Relish the experience of playfully cutting straight through the noise and chaos of various unpredictable mental states and life and take a break from the stubborn sticky impulses of ego in a trance-supported ecstatic dance practice.

Through this technique we experience the blissful absorption of yoga‚Äôs final stages: dhyana, yoga's 7th limb, and then finally, potentially the final 8th stage-Samadhi.

This is a specific progression of movement modes that promote delightfully deep meditation.

There are no complex or challenging poses or dance moves to work out. You do not need to think, figure things out, or worry how you look.

You are in a totally supportive space that has been infused with unconditional love. name: The Feels NY ed 38: a mindful singles event in Brooklyn, NY
description:
An IRL experience for those who are thoughtfully approaching dating.

**// about \\\\**

'The Feels' mixes time to meet and connect casually, with a 90 min facilitated portion. the format was built in partnership with Columbia University; it blends positive psychology, mindfulness, non violent communication + somatic awareness practices.

We believe that when you feel grounded + good in your body, an openness is available - and that space is ideal for connecting to others. We'll guide you to that place.

Data shows that 70% of all attendees walk out with the contact info for someone they're excited about + that 'the feels' is 2x more effective than a typical singles event.

Ticket cost includes unlimited light bites, wine, and non alcoholic beverages.

Read about us in the [NYTimes](https://www.nytimes.com/2023/10/02/style/eye-contact-dating-intimacy-non-monogamous.html), [Thrillist](https://www.thrillist.com/lifestyle/new-york/the-feels-dating-nyc) and/or [Philly Mag](https://www.inquirer.com/life/dating-app-millenials-gen-z-feels-allie-hoffman-20231224.html).

**// the who \\\\**

this edition of the feels is for those who identify as ISO a monogamous(ish) + hetero pairing.

the events are inclusive of ages 25 - 55; if you fall outside those ranges, please know we're working on age segmented 'feels' for you!

![](https://img.evbuc.com/https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.evbuc.com%2Fimages%2F739558959%2F2042575305683%2F1%2Foriginal.20240409-173323?h=740&w=1200&auto=format%2Ccompress&q=75&sharp=10&s=75c13d52cf34ec70bf3b6e35324c44e5)

**// our partners \\\\**

special thanks to

**// pls note \\\\**

**We do not offer refunds, as we're a small business and unable to accommodate refund or credit requests for future events.**

However, you‚Äôre welcome to transfer your ticket to the same event in the same category. For example, if you purchased a Female ticket for NY Feels 12, you can transfer or sell it to another female attendee for that same event. You are responsible for finding a replacement. Once the switch is confirmed, please email us their name and email.

While we typically don't offer credits for future events, we‚Äôre more flexible with our Queer and ENM events as we continue to grow those communities.

**For further questions on ticket transfers please refer to our** [**FAQ page**](https://catchthefeels.co/faqs/)**.**

name: Rising: Lucky Libras
description:
Join us for a night of cosmic connection, sensuality, and balance as Night Owls presents ‚ÄúRising‚Äù, a monthly astrology-themed mixer.

Join us for a night of cosmic connection, sensuality, and balance as Night Owls presents ‚ÄúRising‚Äù, a monthly astrology-themed mixer. This month we celebrate the magnetic allure of Libra at The House, a craft cocktail bar and social club by Hacienda.

\*\*About The House\*\*

The House is more than just a bar; it‚Äôs a sanctuary where lovers of all kinds can come together to build community, dance, and drink to the vibrancy of life.

\*\*About What If\*\*

The What If community, hosted by Lola and Ber ([www.lolaandber.com](http://www.lolaandber.com/)), is an invite-only group of conscious pleasure-seekers. What If weekend and day-long retreats are based in sacred sexuality, and aimed at breaking down preconceptions, improving communication, fostering fantasy, and exploring new avenues for sexual pleasure.

\*\*Why Libra?\*\*

Ruled by Venus, the planet of love and beauty, Libra is the zodiac‚Äôs seducer‚Äîa sign that knows how to charm, entice, and captivate. Whether you‚Äôre drawn to their flirtatious energy or their knack for creating harmony, this is your chance to bask in the glow of Libra‚Äôs sensuality.

\*\*What to Expect\*\*

Dress Code: Think like a Libra: seductive, balanced; equal parts bold and refined

Craft Cocktails: The bar will be serving up craft cocktails and libations for purchase all night long

Mingling: Enjoy astrology-themed games as you connect with members of NYC‚Äôs other s\*x positive communities

Dancing: As the night progresses, we‚Äôll open the dance floor for you to move and connect under the stars

Come ready to let the stars guide your night!

‚Äî

üìß Please note: By RSVPing, your email will be added to the Night Owls, The House, and What If email newsletters. You may unsubscribe at any time.

‚ú® Consent Policy: This is an ASK FIRST event; the rules of respectful and consensual behavior WILL be enforced. Attendees are responsible for reading the policy and behaving appropriately.

\*\*Community Vibes\*\*

üåà This is not a play party! Take this opportunity to meet and mingle with other members of the Night Owls and s\*x positive community in a fun, welcoming atmosphere!

‚Äì

**Community** ‚ù§Ô∏è

Check out what people are saying‚Ä¶

[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MPD9m6hscy3vyr5gJbvwco03mLGqA8bK/view?usp=drivesdk](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MPD9m6hscy3vyr5gJbvwco03mLGqA8bK/view?usp=drivesdk)

‚Äî

**21+ only.**

BYOB

Night Owls is the perfect place to learn, discuss, and join NYC‚Äôs vibrant k\*nk and poly community. This event is for singles, couples, throuples of all genders and orientations, and anything in between.

Night Owls is a s\*x positive community based in NYC offering a range of events from informative talks to fun parties, perfect for seasoned adventurers and curious newcomers alike. Follow us on Instagram ‚Äì[instagram.com/nightowlsig](http://instagram.com/nightowlsig) ‚Äì or visit our website ‚Äì [nightowlsmeet.com](http://nightowlsmeet.com/) ‚Äì to request a free membership and learn about all of our play parties, workshops, and socials!

‚Äî

**Frequently Asked Questions**

‚ú® When / how do I pay? Upon RSVP, guests will receive a secure payment form sent via the email address and phone number provided. This payment form must be completed within 24 hours of receiving it. Any guests who do not complete their payment form within 24 hours of receiving it will have their RSVP voided with no option for re-entry.

‚ú® I can no longer attend. Can I get a refund? Tickets are strictly non-refundable and non-transferable.

‚ú® I‚Äôm not a member, can I buy a ticket? For this event, yes. Only Night Owls events with open playspaces are solely available to registered members. This is to ensure that all guests attending an open play event have agreed to The Night Owls Code of Conduct providing a respectful and safe environment for everyone. The Night Owls Code of Conduct can be found here:

[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fv4E5391miMXOc4djfV2sFwROAZ01vfMzPG3Qnm7uIw/edit?usp=drive\_link](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fv4E5391miMXOc4djfV2sFwROAZ01vfMzPG3Qnm7uIw/edit?usp=drive_link)

For members-only events, you will need to supply the email address associated with your membership as part of the ticket-buying process.

You can apply for free membership here:

[https://form.jotform.com/Night\_Owls/join](https://form.jotform.com/Night_Owls/join)

Please note that each guest MUST be a vetted member with their own membership email. Please do not buy a ticket for a 'guest' as their ticket will be invalid and voided.

‚ú® When can I know the address of the venue? The address of the venue will be sent to approved and confirmed guests via the email address and phone number provided in the membership application.

‚ú® What do I need to bring to get in? Entry is only possible with your payment confirmation email and photo ID. This will be cross-checked with our membership list. If there isn't a photographic match, there will be no entry. Entry is always at the management‚Äôs discretion.

‚ú® Can I bring my own drinks? Yes, you may as the venue does not have an alcohol license. We will provide cups, ice and some soft drinks.

‚ú® Do I have to dress up? In short, yes. Night Owls parties have a strict dress code that must be adhered to. The venue has a free coat check room. You are welcome to come in regular clothes and change at the venue. Guests who do not adhere to the dress code will be refused entry with no refund.

Learn more about our events and free membership here: [http://nightowlsmeet.com/](http://nightowlsmeet.com/)

name: Sinema Club: sex-pos & LGBTQ+ film club: The Hunger with special guest Nancy Roche
description:
House of Scorpio

presents

Sinema Club: The Hunger with special guest Nancy Roche

Wed Oct 16\*, 7-11:30pm, 21+ (25+ suggested), open to all

Main space: movie night, $0-$10 sep on membership level

Bar & lounge: HoS Clubhouse, $FREE\*\*\*

Gemini & Scorpio Loft, 267 Douglass St, 3rd fl (ADA accessible)

Official info & house rules: http://www.houseofscorpio.com/events.html

Memberships & tix: http://www.houseofscorpio.com/membership.html (log in to buy)

FB: https://www.facebook.com/events/838751448443167

FL: https://fetlife.com/events/1609161

PL: https://plra.io/m/sinema-club-sex-pos-and-lgbtq-film-club-the-hunge

Socials: @houseof\_scorpio \[producer\] @gemini\_scorpio \[venue\] #houseofscorpio

The body's largest sex organ is the brain. Sinema Club stimulates yours with films that are explicitly erotic, homo-romantic, or gender-exploring -- and always thought-provoking. A rousing discussion follows; drinking is encouraged throughout, and mingling happens before, during and after: the bar remains open for socializing, while the film plays in the main space. Plus: free popcorn from our vintage cart. Order dinner in, and make it dinner and a movie.

This months screening: hot hot hot noir vampire classic The Hunger (1983) with Catherine Deneuve and David Bowie

When The Hunger was first released, it got mediocre reviews: dismissed as a stylistic triumph at best, but not a particularly noteworthy addition to the vampire movie genre. Yet more than 40 years later, the film remains a cult classic. It's not difficult to see why: look just a little bit beneath the surface of the plot -- a couple of sexy-as-all-hell vampires approach a beautiful young doctor (Susan Sarandon!) when one of the immortals finds they're having a serious health problem -- and you get unexpectedly poignant themes of mortality and loss of long-term domestic partnership alongside the more familiar tropes of power, sex, and bloodsucking. And of course, the film remains aesthetically breathtaking.

Our screening of The Hunger will be followed by a talkback with Nancy Roche, noted writer and academic. Nancy currently teaches film studies with emphases on gender and identity at Belmont University. We will discuss the film -- and vampire mythos in general -- through a queer lens.

Sinema Club is curated and hosted by Phil Guie-Ng (@thatphilguymovies): an inquisitive, ardent longtime film critic who is dying to tell you about movies you haven't heard of yet. As a reviewer at the website Film-Forward, his self-appointed mission was covering documentaries and features about subjects who challenged conventional attitudes about gender, masculinity, and more. When Phil isn't writing about movies, you can find him in Brooklyn taking part in protests on behalf of basic human rights.

\*Sinema Club happens on the third Wednesday of every month

\*\*\*Plus: House of Scorpio Clubhouse. Whatever your membership level, you are invited to use our space as your own for the night...as your clubhouse. While the ticketed activities will take place on the stage side of the room, the bar and lounge will remain open 7pm-11pm (12am if enough people are lounging). Just like with regular events, if you're Friend level and above, you can bring up to two friends with you. Order in dinner, have a few drinks, run a friendly board game, or just read a book on the comfy couch. This is not a mixer -- just us opening our doors for our members. It's up to you how much you socialize, if at all, and with whom.

COVID safety: HoS requires proof of vaccination on file; masks encouraged; two hospital grade UV air purifiers will cycle the air.

name: Hit Me Up: Tie Me Down - Intermediate Precarious Predicaments
description:
Come learn some ways to make your bottoms wiggle and squirm with predicaments!

**Hit Me Up: Tie Me Down - Intermediate Precarious Predicaments**

You've learned some cute ties, but now you want to learn to make someone squirm. The beauty of predicaments is that no matter which way they wiggle, your bottom is going to feel.... something. The struggle is amusing and relief is debatable.

In this class we will discuss what makes a predicament and how to create tension with rope. We will start with a floor tie and then a couple variations of partial suspensions to add to the wiggling. We will cover adding elements like hair rope, toe rope, gags and bamboo. There will be some smaller diameter jute rope that is great for hair rope available for use during class, and if you really like using it you can buy it after class.

This class is labeled at intermediate, which means you are solid with your single column and double column ties. But, this class is beginner friendly in the way that you do not need to know any specific harnesses to participate. We will also go over uplines and how to best utilize them for this type of scene.

Bring your full rope kit (this should include full lengths, half lengths of high quality rope such as jute, nylon or hemp) as well as your preferred rigging equipment (strap, ring and/or carabiners) and cutting shears. If you do not have rigging gear, you can purchase a climbing strap and carabiner at REI before class. We will mostly be using the hard point for stability, so you don‚Äôt need anything too fancy. You should also bring a fabric blind fold and smaller rope if you have it (4mm or twine is ideal!)

Tops: As this is labeled an intermediate class, you should be confident about your single column and double column ties. You should also have solid knowledge of basic frictions. If you need a refresher before class, review some of the videos here: [www.youtube.com/@TrixieLaPointe](http://www.youtube.com/@TrixieLaPointe)

Bottoms: You must feel comfortable being bound in challenging positions but also skilled at communicating your needs.

All bodies are welcome! There will be modifications offered for all body types and flexibility.

**About Your Instructor**

Mistress Trixie LaPointe is a professional rope artist, dominatrix, performer and educator based in NYC. She has been exploring rope since 2018 and has been sharing her knowledge via classes and private lessons since 2021. She has been regularly seen working as a service top or performing at House of Love, House of X, Tempo by Hit Me Up, Femme Fatale, Chemistry and other events around NYC. She is proud proprietor of her own studio space La Maison Priv√©e in Manhattan, where she holds various sessions as well as small classes and events.

**FAQs**

_What should I bring?_

Bring your full rope kit (this should include full lengths, half lengths of rope) as well as your prefered rigging equipment (strap, ring and or carabiners) and cutting shears. You should also bring a fabric blind fold/gag and smaller rope if you have it (4mm or twine is ideal!)

_What should I wear?_

Whatever you feel comfy in! Bodysuits, shorts or snug fitting workout clothes are generally perfect for classes. Please just keep your bottoms on!

_Any pre-requisite skills needed?_

**Tops**: As this is labeled an intermediate class, you should be confident about your single column and double column ties. You should also have solid knowledge of basic frictions. If you need a refresher before class, review some of the videos here: www.youtube.com/@TrixieLaPointe

**Bottoms**: You must feel comfortable being bound in challenging positions but also skilled at communicating your needs.

_Can I attend solo, or do I need to come with a partner?_

This class will be limited to 10 pairs - no solo tickets will be sold so you must come with a partner. Please note - if you are planning to switch, there might not be enough time for you to try every tie twice.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

**STAY IN TOUCH!**

Instagram [@hitmeupnycity](http://www.hitmeupnyc.com/hitmeupnycity)

Join our [public newsletter](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/newsletter)

‚ú®Location: Lower Manhattan. The space has an elevator. Please email [hello@hitmeupnyc.com](mailto:hello@hitmeupnyc.com) if you need any accessibility accommodations.

‚ú®Full vaccination is required. While we recommend getting the booster shots, we are not verifying them at this time.

‚ú®Consent Policy: All of our events are ASK FIRST events. The rules of respectful and consensual behavior WILL be enforced. You will be responsible for reading our consent policy and behaving appropriately. Read our consent policy in full: [https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/consent](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/consent)

‚ú®Membership: We reserve the right to refuse entry if needed. Hit Me Up also hosts private events which are invite only, and anyone new to Hit Me Up must apply and be approved to attend‚Äîno guests or plus ones. Please visit [https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/join](https://www.hitmeupnyc.com/join) to join. You are welcome to inquire as to your status or that of your friends, but please do not act as if you have an entitlement to access our space or members. Building special spaces is hard, and while we are inclusive and welcoming, we reserve the right to curate our membership as needed to maintain our flourishing community. **If you'd like to sponsor a new member please have them apply as soon as possible. If they wait until a few days before the event we cannot guarantee they will be able to be approved in time.**

‚ú®Please stay home if you are feeling ill or if you have had recent close contact with someone who tested Covid positive (within the past 5 days). You could be incubating and still test negative. Any requests for refunds for any reason will be honored up to the day of the party. Remember: safe, sane, and sanitary Just email [hello@hitmeupnyc.com](mailto:hello@hitmeupnyc.com) [mailto:hello@hitmeupnyc.com](mailto:hello@hitmeupnyc.com) and we will give you a full refund, no questions asked.

name: Monthly Roundtable for Polyamory/Non-Monogamy
description:
Join the Downtown Brooklyn Roundtable for Polyamory/Non-monogamy on **October 17,** at the Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture (www.bsec.org) - 269 4th Avenue, between Garfield and 1st Street (Brooklyn). This event recurs on the **Third Thursday** of every month.

The topic will be updated few days before the event.

A couple of important reminders:

*   We kindly ask for a **suggested $10 donation** to help us cover room rental
*   We can bring food/drinks to share (yay!), but please keep in mind the event is still centered on the discussion vs. being a potluck

The Poly Roundtable is a discussion-centered community gathering for those who want to learn about and share experiences/perspectives on topics related to non-monogamy and polyamory. This includes newcomers to poly, long-time practitioners, and those just testing the waters. Folks get a chance to make new friends, learn from each other, share their unique stories and exchange insights that can support successful and healthy non-monogamous relationships. We hope you can join us to contribute, learn, or both!

**Approximate Timeline:**

‚Ä¢ Doors Open - 7 PM

‚Ä¢ 7-7:30 - Arrive, get your name tags, say hi, place your drinks/snacks on the table

‚Ä¢ 7:30-9 - Group discussion

‚Ä¢ 9-10 - Mingle and socialize (and help us clean up the space ;))

**PLEASE NOTE:** This meetup is about creating a safe space for sharing ideas and experiences and having productive and compassionate discussions with old and new friends. It is not a cruising or pickup event, so please do not come with those expectations or intentions as they can make folks uncomfortable and feel unsafe. Help us keep this a safe and supportive space!

Our group values ethics, inclusion, growth and compassion as a means to support each of our unique journeys in developing non-traditional relationships. Please be prepared to bring those values, along with an awareness of the fundamental importance of consent and a respect for all others if you attend our events.

We look forward to welcoming everyone interested or curious about non-monogamy and polyamory :) See you at our new space, the Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture (269 4th Avenue, between Garfield and 1st Street)!

In Community,

~ Clara, Faun & Marco

name: POWER PLAY: Influence & Control
description:
### Workshop: POWER PLAY | Influence & Control

**Hosted by Nix (the Sirenatrix)**

> This transformative edu-series on Power - designed for Dom(mes), subs, and switches - who wish to gain a deeper understanding of influence and surrender. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned veteran, this workshop will enhance your skills and scenes - and perhaps even your perspective.

> This series of workshops will likely change the way you view power exchange, giving you a new appreciation for the intimacy involved in influence. Raising your voice in a domineering way isn‚Äôt the same as influencing your sub with a single whisper‚Äîtrue power tends to be subtle, grounded, intentional, and deeply connected. In **POWER PLAY**, you‚Äôll learn how to get someone‚Äôs entire mind, body, and soul on board with your desires. You‚Äôll learn to play with resistance, use your physicality, and make your presence felt down to the core. Every session will delve into a different facet of power dynamics. Embrace your role, refine your tools, and discover the depths of power exchange in a supportive educational environment.

**Influence & Control**

*   **Beyond Physicality**: Discover ways to make someone melt - without even touching them!
*   **Building Trust**: Learn how to create a safe container for power exchange that allows for vulnerability and growth.
*   **The Dom/me Detector**: I‚Äôll share my technique for ‚Äúscanning‚Äù your sub for the buttons they‚Äôre begging you to push, even if they‚Äôre unaware of them!¬†
*   **Understanding Desires**: You can‚Äôt make someone melt in your hands if you don‚Äôt understand what they desire.¬†

((Come to all four workshops or drop in for just one! ))

‚Äî-------------------------------------------------------------------------

#### Workshop Format:

*   **Discussion and Practical Exercises**: The workshop will include a mix of discussions and hands-on exercises. You'll have the chance to interact with others, practice communication techniques, and receive feedback.¬†
*   **Solo and Group Work**: You can come alone or with a partner. During the exercises, you'll have the opportunity to switch partners, which allows for practicing with familiar partners and new acquaintances. This helps simulate both established dynamics and pickup play scenarios.¬†
*   **Dress Code and Interactions**: Feel free to dress however you want, whether vanilla or ready to play. Expect to interact with others for the exercises, at least in terms of communication and light D/s. More physical play will be saved for the jam afterwards. We do not pair people up, and encourage guests to make friends and engage to their level of comfort ensuring that all are able to learn and grow. Couples can stay paired the whole time or practice with others if you so choose.
*   This workshop is open to all genders, sexual orientations, lifestyles, singles, and couples. All experience levels welcome. 18+.
*   Refunds must be requested 7 days prior to the event.¬†
*   Doors open at 7:30pm and close at 7:40 pm. Please be on time and text ahead if you are delayed.¬†
*   You are welcome to wear a mask throughout the duration of the event.

#### JAM After the Workshop:

Stick around for our jam session, exclusively open to workshop participants. During the jam, you'll have the opportunity to practice your new skills on dungeon furniture in a safe and supportive environment. Nix & Rrrob will be available to offer feedback or conduct activities that cement workshop learning. This is a unique chance to develop muscle memory through hands-on experience, working and learning together in a playful setting.

#### Workshop 7:30-9:30 pm - Jam 9:45pm-11:45pm

#### _Near Herald Square / Address given in confirmation email additional info / Elevator Access available at this location_

#### Pricing:

‚óè **Workshop**: Early Bird $30, Classic $40

‚óè **Workshop and Jam**: Early $55, Classic $75

SAVE WHEN YOU GO TO ALL FOUR: Workshops $140 or Workshop + Jams $260

> POWER PLAY: Fall Series (Thursdays @ Herald Square)

> Power Dynamics 101 (Oct 3rd)

> Pain & Physicality (Oct 10th)

> Influence & Control (Oct 17th)

> Resistance & Brat Taming (Oct 24th)

So come and join us for a night of erotic inspiration and artistic expression.

Don't miss your chance to indulge in this one-of-a-kind experience. Join us at Fetish Figure Drawing and let your inner artist and kinkster shine!

name: ADVENTURE[s] presents: The Robyn Party ROBYN-O-WEEN 2024
description:
#### Event Details

ADVENTURE\[s\] presents:

This Party Is Killing You!: The Robyn Party

ROBYN-O-WEEN 2024

@ 9 Bob Note

October 19 2024, 5-10pm

w special guest OHAILEIGH

The ADVENTURE\[s\] DJs are throwing a spooky, scary installment of The Robyn Party to celebrate Halloween! Come to 9 Bob Note in costume if you can to celebrate the Swedish pop goddess Robyn at the original and longest-running Robyn party and the best pop night on the planet!

Happy October, this one's feeling special... THERE JUST MIGHT BE SOME TREATS IN STORE...üòâ üòÆ

The now-legendary party and its DJs/creators Russ Marshalek, Marley Magaziner, and Chris Choyce were featured by none other than Robyn herself in her short film Missing U, where she drops in on the party for a surprise DJ set.

At The Robyn Party you'll hear all of Robyn's hits, b-sides, lost tracks, remixes, aaaannnd just maybe some tunes you won't hear elsewhere, along with your other pop faves like Carly, Charly, Romy, Gaga, and more. It's a euphoric, uplifting, cry-dancing, life-changing night.

Musically, we‚Äôre gonna get a little weird, a little weird, a little dark. We‚Äôve got some of the darkest stuff and most dance floor-haunting Robyn remixes and creepy femme pop - and then, of course, more Robyn.

Every year, Robyn-O-Ween is a chance for us to spread our bat wings, ‚Äúshow me your teeth‚Äù, and play some tracks that might not always fit at This Party Is Killing You! otherwise, so if you have a haunted pop fave you‚Äôve just been dying hear: send your requests to¬†adventuresbk@gmail.com

Our special guest for this night of Halloween-flavored pop goodness is OHAILEIGH, aka Leigh Barton, from St Vitus, from the internet and from the video for Missing U. She's been a friend and a collaborator for a loooong time and we're excited to welcome her to DJ with us. She spends a lot of time in and around Saint Vitus and with Vitus Presents, and has been called "too spooky" - so we can't wait to hear what she has up her sleeves for us.

There will be multiple costume contests, so if you feel like it - dress to impress:

\-Best Robyn Related cosutme-Best Non-Robyn Pop Diva-Best Group-Judges Fave

For¬†prizes you won't want to miss, and just might have some once in a lifetime chances to win exclusive stuff. And, of course, lots of tricks, and even more treats.

Some special tunes, giveaways, and surprises are in store...so hold tight! You'll understand why more than one fake plastic fang-wearing, fake-blood-covered sweat-drenched partygoer has been heard to exclaim "The Robyn Party saved my life!"

¬†Send haunted femme pop song requests and ALL THE ROBYN REQUESTS!! to¬†adventuresbk@gmail.com¬†

name: Hit Me Up! presents: Gender Affirming Intimacy w/ Lady V & Jamie Love
description:
Tiered pricing: $15 standard, $30 funder level, and $7 access for those in need
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### **_Plura+ Members get 20%!!!_**

### [**Join us after for Bite Club** @ 9 PM, dual ticket discount is available!](https://plra.io/m/hbc24)

About Gender Affirming Intimacy
-------------------------------

Gender dysphoria is when someone has an emotional or physical feeling that feels misaligned with their gender identity. Gender Affirming Intimacy is a workshop geared towards helping ourselves, partners, or other loved ones experience the opposite of dysphoria, gender euphoria!

We'll explore how positive, gender-affirming physical, emotional, & mental intimacy can make ourselves or others feel more aligned with their beautiful, authentic selves.

### We'll achieve this by covering:

*   Learning terminology around Trans bodies
*   Identification of the multiple forms of intimacy
*   Creating euphoria through affirming language
*   Adapting to different forms of sexual & non-sexual touch
*   Finally, towards the end of this class, we will help you develop your own ‚ÄúGender Affirming Profile‚Äù or navigate helping a trans partner create their own Gender Affirming Profile!

Gender non-conforming people may also benefit from pieces of this to create their own unique Gender-Affirming Profiles. People who are not familiar with trans bodies or terminology are also encouraged to attend.

We are here to educate without stigma! Please note this class is GREAT for partners of trans people & trans people alike! This is the question you get to ask questions & learn without judgment!

About the Presenters:
---------------------

### Lady V

Lady V (she/her) is a spiritually & socioculturally driven sex-positive educator, community organizer & Professional Dominatrix. Prior, she served as the Program Manager for one of the few agencies in the world specializing in navigating sexuality & gender for people navigating intellectual/developmental disabilities.

Lady V has taught for conferences & sex positive venues across the US. She serves as an Advocacy Board Member for Sex Positive World & proudly helps facilitate their education as the Remote Education Coordinator. Lady V has also served the community by facilitating public health events.

She is an out, proud, & fierce-as-fire transwoman with a passion for empowering others. While hailing from Detroit, Michigan, she has settled in Salem, Oregon, where she serves as the majordomo for her leather family, the Atomic Army.

She hopes to inspire others to enjoy sex positivity from an authentic place, as well as embrace their spiritual place within sex positivity & find healing within it. You can view more of her work HERE at her¬†[website](https://theladyv.net/)¬†or Fetlife at @‚ÄåThe\_Lady\_V.

### Jamie Love

[@JamieLove\_PDX](https://fetlife.com/JamieLove_PDX)¬†(She/they) is the executive director of Sex Positive World; she has been hosting speed dating since 2019. She is polyamorous, queer, and kinky, with a love of shibari/rope bondage. She leads discussion groups and classes on relationships of all sizes, orientations, and dynamics. Her background is in communications, video production, and marketing; check out her YouTube channel ([http://www.youtube.com/c/givenconsent](http://www.youtube.com/c/givenconsent)¬†) and or social media @‚ÄåExploringJamie

### About Sex Positive World:

Sex Positive World is an umbrella organization that encourages and supports worldwide sex-positive communities

We are an entirely volunteer-run non-profit committed to changing societal ideas and values around sexuality through education and empowerment. Our umbrella covers all aspects of human sexuality, including gender and orientation (LGBTQIA), relationship styles (monogamy-polyamory), and sexual expressions (kink, tantra, lifestyle).

We focus on consent and boundaries, how to have a sexy safer sex talk, body-positivity, healthy touch, sexual health, reproductive freedom, trans rights, anti-racism (yes, this is a sex-positive issue!), sex-positive parenting, and more. This organization was founded in 2009 as a single chapter in Portland, Oregon, and we have since expanded to more than 5,000 members and 10 chapters in cities across the US and Europe.¬†[Learn more about SPW¬†**HERE**!](https://sexpositiveworld.org/)

### About Sex Positive World:

Sex Positive World is an umbrella organization that encourages and supports worldwide sex-positive communities

We are an entirely volunteer-run non-profit committed to changing societal ideas and values around sexuality through education and empowerment. Our umbrella covers all aspects of human sexuality, including gender and orientation (LGBTQIA), relationship styles (monogamy-polyamory), and sexual expressions (kink, tantra, lifestyle).

We focus on consent and boundaries, how to have a sexy safer sex talk, body-positivity, healthy touch, sexual health, reproductive freedom, trans rights, anti-racism (yes, this is a sex-positive issue!), sex-positive parenting, and more. This organization was founded in 2009 as a single chapter in Portland, Oregon, and we have since expanded to more than 5,000 members and 10 chapters in cities across the US and Europe.¬†[Learn more about SPW¬†**HERE**!](https://sexpositiveworld.org/)

About Hit Me Up
---------------

_Want to see what other events are coming up? Join our public newsletter and follow us on insta (@hitmeupnycity)_

**üíú¬†Location**: Lower Manhattan.

üíú Accessibility: The space has an elevator & ADA accessible bathroom on the 5th floor. Please email¬†[**hello@hitmeupnyc.com**](mailto:hello@hitmeupnyc.com)¬†if you need any accessibility accommodations or questions.

üíú¬†**Full vaccination is required**. While we recommend getting the booster shots, we are not verifying them at this time.

üíú¬†**Consent Policy:**¬†This event is for ropes and other general kink play. Please keep your bottoms on during your scenes. This is an ASK FIRST event and the rules of respectful and consensual behavior WILL be enforced. You will be responsible for reading the policy and behaving appropriately. Please click here to read our consent policy in full.

üíú¬†**Membership:**¬†This event is open to the public. We reserve the right to refuse entry if needed. Hit Me Up also hosts private events which are invite only, and anyone new to Hit Me Up must apply and be approved to attend‚Äîno guests or plus ones. If you‚Äôd like to apply or invite a new member, please see our website for more information. You are welcome to inquire as to your status or that of your friends, but please do not act as if you have an entitlement to access our space or members. Building special spaces is hard, and while we are inclusive and welcoming, we reserve the right to curate our membership as needed to maintain our flourishing community.

üíú Please stay home if you are feeling ill or if you have had recent close contact with someone who tested Covid positive (within the past 5 days). You could be incubating and still test negative. Any requests for refunds for any reason will be honored up to the day of the party. Remember: safe, sane, and sanitary Just email¬†[hello@hitmeupnyc.com](mailto:hello@hitmeupnyc.com)¬†and we will give you a full refund, no questions asked.

### Volunteer Opportunities

We're looking for volunteers to help make this event a success. Earn a free full-day pass by completing two volunteer shifts. Please¬†**email**¬†[**info@sexpositiveworld.org**](mailto:info@sexpositiveworld.org)¬†with your contact information and let us know if you have universal guardian training.

name: From Seoul to Paris: Seoyeon Im Swing Quartet
description:
The¬†**Seoyeon Im Swing Quartet**¬†warmly invites you to an intimate evening of sultry acoustic rhythms and spirited improvisation, transporting you from the winding streets of Montmartre to the lively jazz bars of Seoul. Begin your Saturday night with a glass of sparkling champagne, as the Quartet‚Äôs jazz manouche fills the air with an irresistible joie de vivre, setting the perfect tone to carry you blissfully through the weekend.

**Seoyeon**, better known to many as ‚ÄòV.OLIN‚Äô, is one of well-known Jazz Violinist to have emerged in South Korea. Now She is based in New York, she‚Äôs built up a reputation as a rising star in the world of jazz violin/swing jazz scene. While much of her performance career has revolved around classical music, Seoyeon now finds herself exploring the ‚ÄòGypsy Jazz & Modern Jazz ‚Äôworld, where she is routinely playing gigs in the mostly New York area included Carnegie Hall, Zinc Jazz Club, Ornithology Jazz Club, Sheen Music Center, Clement‚Äôs Place and more.

_Doors open at 5:45. Band at 6:15pm. Walk-ins welcome. 2 Drink Minimum per person for table service. 21+ ID Required. All Sales Final._

**Frequently Asked Questions**

‚ú® When / how do I pay? Upon RSVP, guests will receive a secure payment form sent via the email address and phone number provided. name: A Rock and a Hard Place: Predicaments for AMAB Bottoms
description:
Join Petite Pretzel and KinkNamePending for an evening class on predicament bondage tailored specifically for the AMAB rope bottom. Our seasoned sadist, Pretzel, and power bottom, KNP, teach the art of prolonging and intensifying your bottom's suffering with meticulous precision. This is an open-ended exploration where students are encouraged to adapt the concepts to suit their unique dynamics and preferences. There's no one-size-fits-all approach; it's about embracing the process of learning and relishing the overall experience.

In this class, we delve into predicament bondage: crafting dilemmas that force the rope bottom to choose between different forms of pain, exhaustion, or humiliation. This is not a collaborative tie; it's a constantly evolving game of cat-and-mouse. The rope bottom seeks escape or respite, and the top skillfully removes those options, creating a captivating dance of control and surrender.

As your ‚Äúevil genius‚Äù guide, Pretzel thrives on creating challenges that evolve into prolonged and increasingly difficult struggle. Her class "A Rock and a Hard Place: Predicaments for Penis-Owners" aims to strike a balance. It's not about making it so challenging that one gives up immediately or so easy that boredom sets in; it's about creating a dialogue through rope. The ropes become a medium for communication, a conversation where suggestions and responses inspire each other.

#### Tickets sold as pairs.

### [RSVP](https://app.acuityscheduling.com/schedule.php?owner=27853603&appointmentType=67520093)¬†$140 per pair

_$60 deposit, $80 cash at the start of class_

#### **This class will cover:**

*   Detailed anatomical information, to improve the efficacy of predicaments and ensure safety
*   Psychological discussion of the perspectives of both top and bottom
*   Intimate ties for genitals, specifically penis and testicles

#### **Who can attend this class? Are there prerequisites?**

*   Riggers should know how to proficiently tie the TK and proficient at tying mainlines/suspension lines.
*   Riggers must know how to check for nerve impingement. You must inform your model of the risks of rope suspension.
*   Riggers and models must have tied together prior to this class
*   Rope bottoms should be able to be tied in an upper body harness and be very familiar with the differences between nerve and circulation impingement.
*   Models must be able to recognise and communicate signs of nerve impingement to riggers effectively and timely. Models should be able to process pain and take enjoyment in intense sensations.

#### **What should I bring and what do I wear?**

People usually wear comfortable clothing like yoga or dance attire. We advise against loose fitting clothing and also jeans can sometimes feel a bit restrictive to move around in and difficult to tie on. Bring your own rope.

#### **Who teaches this class?**

Petite Pretzel is a rope switch from New York City. She has been teaching shibari (Japanese rope bondage) since 2019 at Anatomie Studio London, as well as at other UK venues (Oxford Rope Bight, Tangled Festival Derby, Edinburgh Rope Showcase), and abroad in the USA (Temple NYC), Greece (Athens Shibari), Germany (Eurix), and Sweden (Stockholm Pride). She has performed and taught live for Shambala Festival, Pinky Promise, Riposte Queer Rave, Fox & Badge. Her commercial rigging includes music video credits (Charli XCX, Christine + the Queens), art gallery installation (Elizabeth Xi Bauer gallery), fashion photography and full-length film. She lives in Bethnal Green with her cat, who loves ropes just as much as she does. You can find her on Twitter as @PetitePretzel and Instagram as @Petite\_Pretzel.¬†

Pen (KinkNamePending) is a UK-based rope switch from Croydon, South London. He loves the connections that shibari inspires and the wide range of experiences with vulnerability and trust it has brought him. Outside of rope, he is keenly interested in anatomy and physiology and has studied these topics extensively. He brings his perspective and understanding of the human body into rope and kink. He has performed in the UK as a rope-bottom at Tangled Festival, the Lust Supper, Pinky Promise and Fox Badge; and additionally abroad at Temple NYC in the USA, Eurix (European Rope Exchange) in Germany and for Stockholm Pride in Sweden. You can find him on Twitter and Instagram as @KinkNamePending.

name: HMU Academy: Rethinking Decoupling & De-escalation
description:
We will be discussing the barriers regarding changing or ending partnerships, and how to move through them in new and imaginative ways.

The idea of ending or even changing a relationship dynamic with someone, is terrifying, partly because we fear losing someone we have grown intimate with and because of the messaging we've received about romantic partnerships from the dominant culture leading us to view breaking up, or even a relationship taking on a different form, as the relationship failing. This idea keeps people in relationship dynamics that are no longer serving them, barring them from their own authentic needs and desires.

Championing our own autonomy and our partner's(s) is crucial, in welcoming shifts to our relationships if something is not working for us.

This workshop dives into the emotional and tangible impact of major relationship shifts, and how to move them with compassion, grace and self assuredness.

Key Takeaways:

\-Tools on how to initiate and welcome ALL major changes in relationships

\-Deepened understanding of the "relationship escalator" and how it influences why we stay in relationship structures that no longer serve us

\-Templates, ceremonies and rituals on how to have a conscious, proactive and loving decoupling

**About Your Instructors**

Bear (he/him) & Fifi (all pronouns) are New York City-based Intimacy Coaches, Community Consultants, Event Producers, and Educators. Their work challenges social binaries and standards, addresses the personal barriers that limit human connection, and offers alternative ways of relating that center consent & safety, authenticity, and personal agency on an interpersonal and collective scale. [Follow them on IG here](https://www.instagram.com/bearxfifi/).
